meanings.sent1: The cake had a mealier texture than the cookies.
meanings.sent2: The flour felt mealier than the sugar.
meanings.sent3: The mealier bread crumbled easily, making a mess on the table.
meanings.sent4: The mealier soil absorbed water quickly, like a sponge.
meanings.sent5: The mealier sand stuck to their feet, leaving a trail behind.

meanings.definition: Having a coarse or granular texture.
meanings.sent1: The mealier fabric irritated her skin.
meanings.sent2: The mealier paper felt rough to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The mealier surface of the rock scratched his hand.
meanings.sent4: The mealier texture of the carpet reminded her of walking on pebbles.
meanings.sent5: The mealier texture of the wood made it difficult to sand smoothly.

meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of meal.
meanings.sent1: The mealier dough stuck to the rolling pin.
meanings.sent2: The mealier chicken coating was crisp and flavorful.
meanings.sent3: The mealier pancakes were a bit too dry for her taste.
meanings.sent4: The mealier surface of the fish fillet absorbed the seasoning well.
meanings.sent5: The mealier crust of the pie crumbled easily under the fork.
